mission_statement: Walmart today is a people-led, tech-powered omnichannel retailer dedicated to helping people save money and live better.
products_or_services: Retail stores; E-commerce; Sam's Club (membership-based retail); Walmart International (retail operations in 18 countries); Financial services; Health and Wellness services
founding_year_and_founders: Founded in 1962 by Sam Walton in Rogers, Arkansas.
key_executives: President and CEO, Walmart Inc.: Doug McMillon; Executive Vice President, Corporate Affairs, Walmart Inc.: Dan Bartlett; Executive Vice President of Global Governance, Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary, Walmart Inc.: Rachel Brand; President and CEO, Walmart U.S.: John Furner; Executive Vice President, Global Chief Technology Officer and Chief Development Officer, Walmart Inc.: Suresh Kumar; President and CEO, Walmart International: Kathryn McLay; Executive Vice President and Chief People Officer, Walmart Inc.: Donna Morris; President and CEO, Sam's Club: Chris Nicholas; Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, Walmart Inc.: John David Rainey; Chairman of the Walmart Inc. Board of Directors: Gregory B. Penner
notable_awards: Walmart named one of Canada’s Top 10 Most Influential Brands for the 10th year in a row.

mission_statement: We will provide branded products and services of superior quality and value that improve the lives of the world’s consumers, now and for generations to come. As a result, consumers will reward us with leadership sales, profit and value creation, allowing our people, our shareholders and the communities in which we live and work to prosper.
products_or_services: Baby Care; Fabric Care; Family Care; Feminine Care; Grooming; Hair Care; Home Care; Oral Care; Personal Health Care; Skin & Personal Care
founding_year_and_founders: Founded more than 185 years ago by William Procter and James Gamble.
headquarters_location: Not explicitly mentioned, but operations in more than 180 countries.
key_executives: Jon R. Moeller, Chairman of the Board, President and Chief Executive Officer; Shailesh G. Jejurikar, Chief Operating Officer; Andre Schulten, Chief Financial Officer
notable_awards: America’s Most Innovative Companies - Fortune; Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion - Disability:IN; World's Most Admired Companies - Fortune

mission_statement: Pioneer sustainable aerospace for a safe and united world.
products_or_services: Commercial aircraft; Helicopters; Military transport; Satellites; Defence and Space solutions
founding_year_and_founders: The first Airbus aircraft, the A300B1, first took to the skies on October 28th, 1972. (Airbus’ predecessor companies from France, Germany, the UK, and Spain laid the foundation for today’s industry leader in the late 1960s)
headquarters_location: Not explicitly stated in the provided text. It is implied that they have sites in multiple countries, including France, Germany, the UK, and Spain, and a presence in Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific, and Africa/Middle East.

mission_statement: Chevron’s purpose is to provide affordable, reliable, ever-cleaner energy. To enable human progress.
products_or_services: Oil and natural gas; Fuels; Lubricants; Chemicals and additives; Renewable fuels; Carbon capture and storage; Hydrogen; Geothermal
founding_year_and_founders: The company entered the industry in 1879 as Pacific Coast Oil Co. (PCO)
headquarters_location: Houston, TX, USA (moved from San Ramon, CA in 2024)
key_executives: Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer: Michael K. (Mike) Wirth; Lead Director: Wanda M. Austin; Vice Chairman: Mark A. Nelson; Vice President and Chief Financial Officer: Eimear P. Bonner
notable_awards: Army-Navy “E” for excellence four times during World War II for its record production supporting the war effort (Socal’s Richmond Refinery); U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service award for outstanding stewardship and long-term dedication to thistle recovery efforts (Guadalupe restoration project); Volunteerism award for sponsorship of Tiganokinisi Caravan (Chevron, Cyprus)

mission_statement: Build a world that works, for everyone. The Energy to Change the World (GE Vernova)
products_or_services: GE Aerospace: Propulsion, services and systems for commercial and military aircraft.; GE Vernova: Power, Wind, Electrification businesses, Advanced Research, Consulting Services, and Financial Services for energy transition.; GE HealthCare: Medical technology, pharmaceutical diagnostics, and digital solutions.
founding_year_and_founders: Founded in 1892 (However, the text also mentions 'For more than 130 years'), original CEO Charles Coffin, whom Thomas Edison respected.
headquarters_location: GE Vernova is headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, U.S.
key_executives: Chairman and CEO, GE CEO, GE Aerospace: H. Lawrence Culp, Jr.
notable_awards: HA gas turbine earned a Guinness World Record for efficiency twice (2016 & 2017)

mission_statement: We are committed to redefining healthcare: connecting the best of Health&Care for every provider, for every patient, for everyone. Put simply, Our Credo challenges us to put the needs and well-being of the people we serve first.

founding_year_and_founders: Founded in 1886 by Robert Wood Johnson, Edward Mead Johnson and James Wood Johnson.
